Caption: Figure 2: 2D slices of CO2 concentrations at different periods of the day, a) Morning, b) Noon, c) Evening. Note, high CO2 concentrations are located at areas with high population or heavy industrial activity. Iso-contours depicting CO2 concentrations at different atmospheric heights, a) layer nearest surface (35 m), b) 750 m, c) 2500 m
Figure 3: Isosurfaces extracted using marching cubes. Note how CO2 is traveling from the United States in the first image and into Mexico and across the Atlantic Ocean in the second image.
Figure 1: a) A histogram for the entire U.S. in early May. b) A his- togram for late August. Notice how the CO2 values have shifted to the right.
